how to edit shirt: First, select a shirt from the list in the tabs (In Drawer, Laundry, or Worn). Then use the 'Edit Selected Shirt' form on the right to modify its details. Click 'ğŸ’¾ Save Changes' when done.
how to upload image: Click the 'ğŸ“· Add Image' button in the Add form, or 'ğŸ“· Change Image' in the Edit form. Select a valid image file (JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP) from your computer.
how to delete shirt: Select the shirt you want to delete from the list, then click the 'ğŸ—‘ï¸ Delete Shirt' button in the Edit Selected Shirt section. Confirm the deletion when prompted.
how to search: Use the search bar at the top of the window. Type any part of a shirt's name, color, size, or status to filter the list instantly. Click 'Clear' to reset the search.
how to view statistics: Click the 'ğŸ“Š Statistics' button at the top to see detailed analytics about your inventory, including counts by status, color, size, and image usage.
how to change status: Select a shirt from the list, then use the Status dropdown in the Edit form, or use the chatbot command: 'move [shirt name] to [status]'.
what are statuses: Your shirts can have three statuses: 'In Drawer' (clean and stored), 'Laundry' (needs washing), and 'Worn' (recently worn).
error image upload: If image upload fails, make sure: 1) The file is a valid image format (JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP), 2) The file isn't corrupted, 3) You have proper file permissions.
error shirt not found: The shirt you're looking for might not exist. Try searching with different terms, or check if you spelled the name correctly. Use 'show inventory' to see all shirts.
error required fields: Name, Color, and Size are required when adding or editing a shirt. Make sure all three fields are filled in before saving.
app overview: The Shirt Inventory Tracker helps you organize your shirts across three states: In Drawer, Laundry, and Worn. You can add images, search, edit details, and view statistics.
keyboard shortcuts: Press Enter in the search bar to clear it. Press Enter in the chatbot input to send your message. Use the tabs to switch between shirt statuses.
best practices: Keep shirt names descriptive (e.g., 'Blue Polo' instead of 'Shirt 1'). Add images to easily identify shirts. Regularly update statuses to track laundry needs.
